description: Indicates that the style extensions ([style](extension-rendering-style.html), [markdown](extension-rendering-markdown.html)) and [xhtml](extension-rendering-xhtml.html)) in this resource are essential to the interpretation of the styled text and that it cannot be rendered without the style without losing essential information.

element.comment: If set to true, all systems that claim to support this extension and which render elements of the resource containing this extension SHALL either render the content as required by the style extensions defined by this profile that are present in the resource or shall (if safe to do so based on their own rules), omit entirely the styled content they cannot render in accordance with the extensions.
element.definition: Indicates that the style extensions ([style](extension-rendering-style.html), [markdown](extension-rendering-markdown.html)) and [xhtml](extension-rendering-xhtml.html)) in this resource are essential to the interpretation of the styled text and that it cannot be rendered without the style without losing essential information.

name: styleSensitive

element.comment: If set to true, all systems that claim to support this extension and which render elements of the resource containing this extension SHALL either render the content as required by the style extensions defined by this profile that are present in the resource or shall (if safe to do so based on their own rules), omit entirely the styled content they cannot render in accordance with the extensions.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Indicates that the style extensions ([style](extension-rendering-style.html), [markdown](extension-rendering-markdown.html)) and [xhtml](extension-rendering-xhtml.html)) in this resource are essential to the interpretation of the styled text and that it cannot be rendered without the style without losing essential information.
Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension

element.definition: Value of extension - may be a resource or one of a constrained set of the data types (see Extensibility in the spec for list).
